elements.title: Patrick J. Hessian (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Patrick J. Hessian (pictured), the 16th Chief of Chaplains of the United States Army, earned the Soldier's Medal for disarming a suicidal soldier who was holding a live grenade with the pin pulled?

elements.title: Ácido Argentino (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rolling Stone listed Ácido Argentino as the most essential album of Argentine heavy metal?

elements.title: La Mojana (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that people of the Zenú culture built canals in the La Mojana wetland area of Colombia long before Spanish arrival?

elements.title: Kaylee Bryson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kaylee Bryson was the first female driver to advance to the A-Main feature race at the Chili Bowl Nationals?

elements.title: Villa of Augustus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Villa of Augustus was found buried beneath another villa?

elements.title: Suiattle River (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that every summer, the Suiattle River dirties the Sauk with glacial debris?

elements.title: Donald MacKay (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that architect Donald MacKay designed a fire station which later burnt down in the Great Seattle Fire?

elements.title: Earl de Grey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to legend, after one of the Earl de Grey's parrots was killed, the other never spoke again?
